name: Amazon EC2
description: Secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It provides granular control over virtual servers.
useCase: Hosting websites, enterprise applications, gaming servers.
pricingModel: On-Demand, Spot, Reserved Instances, Savings Plans

name: AWS Lambda
description: Run code without thinking about servers. Upload your code and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale it.
useCase: API backends, file processing, scheduled cron jobs, event-driven applications.
pricingModel: Pay per request & compute time (duration * memory)
freeTier: 1 million requests & 400,000 GB-seconds per month (Always Free)

name: Amazon S3
description: Object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance.
useCase: Backup and restore, static website hosting, data lakes, archive.
pricingModel: Pay for storage used (GB), requests, and data transfer out
freeTier: 5GB Standard Storage, 20,000 Get Requests, 2,000 Put Requests for 12 months
cons: Consistency models can be complex (though improved)
High request costs for small objects

name: Amazon DynamoDB
description: Key-value and document database that delivers single-digit millisecond performance at any scale.
useCase: Mobile backends, gaming leaderboards, shopping carts, real-time bidding.
pricingModel: On-demand (pay per R/W request) or Provisioned Capacity
cons: Cost can spike with poor schema design

name: Amazon RDS
description: Managed relational database service that makes it easier to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud.
useCase: Traditional web applications (WordPress, Magento), ERPs, structured data.
freeTier: 750 hours/month of db.t2.micro or db.t3.micro Single-AZ for 12 months
pros: Supports MySQL, Postgres, MariaDB, SQL Server, Oracle
cons: Downtime for some vertical scaling operations
